subject: Drug Abuse and Traffic
lead_paragraph: A judge in Norristown, Pa., who sentenced the sons of Philadelphia Eagles Coach Andy Reid to jail yesterday likened the coach’s home to “a drug emporium” and questioned whether his adult sons should live there, given their drug problems. Montgomery County Judge Steven O’Neill noted that searches of the Reid family’s home and vehicles found a long list of drugs, guns and ammunition.“There isn’t any structure there that this court can depend upon,” O’Neill said before sentencing Reid’s son Britt to up to 23 months in jail plus probation.Earlier yesterday, O’Neill sentenced Garrett Reid, a drug addict and a dealer, to up to 23 months in jail for smashing into another motorist’s car while high on heroin.
